Garrett Knuf
  • About
  • Portfolio

WS2812b Digital Interface

Individually Addressable RGB LED Driver Digital Interface designed in Verilog. Reverse-engineered from WS2812b datasheet and implemented on Basys 3 Artix-7 FPGA.

Digital Design, Verilog, FPGA

Caltech10 8-bit CPU

8-bit Harvard-architecture, accumulator-based CPU. The CPU has an 8-bit accumulator, two 8-bit data addressing registers (X and S) and a 13-bit program counter. All instructions are a single 16-bit word and almost all instructions execute in a single clock cycle.

Digital Design, ABEL, CPU Architecture

ADSR Synthesizer Module

PCB designed with AVR microcontroller and SPI Digital-to-Analog Converter to generate square, sine, triangle, and sawtooth waves. Potentiometers are used to control ADSR (attack, decay, sustain, release) envelopes of waveforms.

PCB Design, AVR Microcontroller, Waveform Generation

Mixed-mode Electric Piano

This piano uses a DAC to convert keypresses into an analog voltage. A voltage to frequency converter designed with op amps generates a frequency corresponding key pressed. A three-stage low pass filter creates sine wave and a transistor operated in triode region allows non-linear gain for note fading effects.

Op amps, Low pass filters, Transistors

FSAE Dashboard Electronics

PCB designed with STM32 microcontroller to process dashboard controls of Formula SAE racing car. It handles debouncing of buttons, rotary encoders, LCD display, and communicating with other systems via CAN bus.

STM32, Altium, CAN, LCD, Power Electronics

Ping Pong Ball LED Clock

This project contains individually addressable LED strips and 128 ping pong balls acting as light diffusers to construct a clock. It has several modes and animations controlled by an Infrared remote and Arduino.

Arduino, RTC, FastLED, IR receiver

AVR Assembly Game

This board is programmed in AVR assembly to run an interactive Binario game. Features on this board includes a multiplexed 8x8 LED matrix, debounced switches and encoders, tone generation, and EEROM.

AVR Assembly, LED matrix, SPI EEROM

Maze Navigating Robot

The Normstorm is a 2 wheeled autonomous rover designed to explore maps. The bot sees the world through 3 IR sensors and 3 ultrasound detectors. It implements advanced maze navigating algorithms and decision-making processes. The motor and sensors are controlled with a Raspberry Pi.

Python, Algorithms, Raspberry Pi

FIRST Robotics Shooter

CAD of shooter mechanism that successfully competed in 2020 FIRST Robotics Competition. The mechanism rotates on a turret and has flywheels to launch foam balls into a 3ft wide target from 30 feet away. A robust adjustable hood was also designed to change the launch angle.

Mechanical Engineering, Solidworks

Arduino Smart Home

This project was designed as 15-lesson course for students to learn about electronics. Each lesson, students learn how to implement and code a new component with an Arduino, including LEDs, buttons, DC motors, servo motors, stepper motors, infrared sensor, liquid crystal displays, joysticks, photoresistors, and ultrasonic sensors.

Arduino, DIY Electronics
